eventdef-bluetooth-availabilitychanged.name: availabilitychanged_event
eventdef-bluetooth-availabilitychanged.summary: The availabilitychanged event fires when the Bluetooth system as a whole becomes available or unavailable to the User Agent.
eventdef-bluetooth-availabilitychanged.title: Bluetooth: availabilitychanged event

dom-bluetooth-onavailabilitychanged.name: availabilitychanged_event
dom-bluetooth-onavailabilitychanged.summary: The availabilitychanged event fires when the Bluetooth system as a whole becomes available or unavailable to the User Agent.
dom-bluetooth-onavailabilitychanged.title: Bluetooth: availabilitychanged event

dom-bluetooth-getavailability.name: getAvailability
dom-bluetooth-getavailability.summary: The getAvailability() method of the Bluetooth interface returns true if the device has a Bluetooth adapter, and false otherwise (unless the user has configured the browser to not expose a real value).
dom-bluetooth-getavailability.title: Bluetooth.getAvailability()

dom-bluetooth-getdevices.name: getDevices
dom-bluetooth-getdevices.summary: The getDevices() method of Bluetooth interface of Web Bluetooth API exposes the Bluetooth devices this origin is allowed to access. This method does not display any permission prompts.
dom-bluetooth-getdevices.title: Bluetooth.getDevices()

dom-bluetooth-referringdevice.name: referringDevice
dom-bluetooth-referringdevice.summary: The Bluetooth.referringDevice attribute of the Bluetooth interface returns a BluetoothDevice if the current document was opened in response to an instruction sent by this device and null otherwise.
dom-bluetooth-referringdevice.title: Bluetooth.referringDevice

dom-bluetooth-requestdevice.name: requestDevice
dom-bluetooth-requestdevice.summary: The Bluetooth.requestDevice() method of the Bluetooth interface returns a Promise to a BluetoothDevice object with the specified options. If there is no chooser UI, this method returns the first device matching the criteria.
dom-bluetooth-requestdevice.title: Bluetooth.requestDevice()

bluetooth.name: Bluetooth
bluetooth.summary: The Bluetooth interface of the Web Bluetooth API returns a Promise to a BluetoothDevice object with the specified options.

chrome.notes: Before Chrome 70, this feature was only supported in macOS. In Chrome 70, support was added for Windows 10. Linux support is not enabled by default.
In Linux and versions of Windows earlier than 10, this flag must be enabled.

edge_blink.notes: Before Chrome 70, this feature was only supported in macOS. In Chrome 70, support was added for Windows 10. Linux support is not enabled by default.
In Linux and versions of Windows earlier than 10, this flag must be enabled.

bluetooth.title: Bluetooth

dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-au.name: authenticatedSignedWrites
dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-au.summary: The authenticatedSignedWrites read-only property of the BluetoothCharacteristicProperties interface returns a boolean that is true if signed writing to the characteristic value is permitted.
dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-au.title: BluetoothCharacteristicProperties.authenticatedSignedWrites

dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-br.name: broadcast
dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-br.summary: The broadcast read-only property of the BluetoothCharacteristicProperties interface returns a boolean that is true if the broadcast of the characteristic value is permitted using the Server Characteristic Configuration Descriptor.
dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-br.title: BluetoothCharacteristicProperties.broadcast

dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-in.name: indicate
dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-in.summary: The indicate read-only property of the BluetoothCharacteristicProperties interface returns a boolean that is true if indications of the characteristic value with acknowledgement is permitted.
dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-in.title: BluetoothCharacteristicProperties.indicate

dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-no.name: notify
dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-no.summary: The notify read-only property of the BluetoothCharacteristicProperties interface returns a boolean that is true if notifications of the characteristic value without acknowledgement is permitted.
dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-no.title: BluetoothCharacteristicProperties.notify

dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-re.name: read
dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-re.summary: The read read-only property of the BluetoothCharacteristicProperties interface returns a boolean that is true if the reading of the characteristic value is permitted.
dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-re.title: BluetoothCharacteristicProperties.read

dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-re.name: reliableWrite
dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-re.summary: The reliableWrite read-only property of the BluetoothCharacteristicProperties interface returns a boolean that is true if reliable writes to the characteristic is permitted.
dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-re.title: BluetoothCharacteristicProperties.reliableWrite

dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-wr.name: writableAuxiliaries
dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-wr.summary: The writableAuxiliaries read-only property of the BluetoothCharacteristicProperties interface returns a boolean that is true if reliable writes to the characteristic descriptor is permitted.
dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-wr.title: BluetoothCharacteristicProperties.writableAuxiliaries

dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-wr.name: write
dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-wr.summary: The write read-only property of the BluetoothCharacteristicProperties interface returns a boolean that is true if the writing to the characteristic with response is permitted.
dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-wr.title: BluetoothCharacteristicProperties.write

dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-wr.name: writeWithoutResponse
dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-wr.summary: The writeWithoutResponse read-only property of the BluetoothCharacteristicProperties interface returns a boolean that is true if the writing to the characteristic without response is permitted.
dom-bluetoothcharacteristicproperties-wr.title: BluetoothCharacteristicProperties.writeWithoutResponse

characteristicproperties-interface.name: BluetoothCharacteristicProperties
characteristicproperties-interface.summary: The BluetoothCharacteristicProperties interface of the Web Bluetooth API provides the operations that are valid on the given BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.

chrome.notes: Before Chrome 70, this feature was only supported in macOS. In Chrome 70, support was added for Windows 10. Linux support is not enabled by default.
In Linux and versions of Windows earlier than 10, this flag must be enabled.

edge_blink.notes: Before Chrome 70, this feature was only supported in macOS. In Chrome 70, support was added for Windows 10. Linux support is not enabled by default.
In Linux and versions of Windows earlier than 10, this flag must be enabled.

characteristicproperties-interface.title: BluetoothCharacteristicProperties

dom-bluetoothdevice-gatt.name: gatt
dom-bluetoothdevice-gatt.summary: The BluetoothDevice.gatt read-only property returns a reference to the device's BluetoothRemoteGATTServer.
dom-bluetoothdevice-gatt.title: BluetoothDevice.gatt

dom-bluetoothdevice-id.name: id
dom-bluetoothdevice-id.summary: The BluetoothDevice.id read-only property returns a string that uniquely identifies a device.
dom-bluetoothdevice-id.title: BluetoothDevice.id

dom-bluetoothdevice-name.name: name
dom-bluetoothdevice-name.summary: The BluetoothDevice.name read-only property returns a string that provides a human-readable name for the device.
dom-bluetoothdevice-name.title: BluetoothDevice.name

bluetoothdevice-interface.name: BluetoothDevice
bluetoothdevice-interface.summary: The BluetoothDevice interface of the Web Bluetooth API represents a Bluetooth device inside a particular script execution environment.

chrome.notes: Before Chrome 70, this feature was only supported in macOS. In Chrome 70, support was added for Windows 10. Linux support is not enabled by default.
In Linux and versions of Windows earlier than 10, this flag must be enabled.

edge_blink.notes: Before Chrome 70, this feature was only supported in macOS. In Chrome 70, support was added for Windows 10. Linux support is not enabled by default.
In Linux and versions of Windows earlier than 10, this flag must be enabled.

bluetoothdevice-interface.title: BluetoothDevice

dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-ge.name: getDescriptor
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-ge.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.getDescriptor() method returns a Promise that resolves to the first BluetoothRemoteGATTDescriptor for a given descriptor UUID.
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-ge.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.getDescriptor()

dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-ge.name: getDescriptors
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-ge.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.getDescriptors() method returns a Promise that resolves to an Array of all BluetoothRemoteGATTDescriptor objects for a given descriptor UUID.
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-ge.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.getDescriptors()

dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-pr.name: properties
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-pr.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.properties read-only property returns a BluetoothCharacteristicProperties instance containing the properties of this characteristic.
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-pr.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.properties

dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-re.name: readValue
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-re.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.readValue() method returns a Promise that resolves to a DataView holding a duplicate of the value property if it is available and supported. Otherwise it throws an error.
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-re.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.readValue()

dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-se.name: service
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-se.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.service read-only property returns the BluetoothRemoteGATTService this characteristic belongs to.
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-se.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.service

dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-st.name: startNotifications
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-st.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.startNotifications() method returns a Promise to the BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic instance when there is an active notification on it.
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-st.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.startNotifications()

dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-st.name: stopNotifications
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-st.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.stopNotifications() method returns a Promise to the BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic instance when there is no longer an active notification on it.
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-st.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.stopNotifications()

dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-uu.name: uuid
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-uu.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.uuid read-only property returns a string containing the UUID of the characteristic, for example '00002a37-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb' for the Heart Rate Measurement characteristic.
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-uu.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.uuid

dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-va.name: value
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-va.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.value read-only property returns currently cached characteristic value. This value gets updated when the value of the characteristic is read or updated via a notification or indication.
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-va.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.value

dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-wr.name: writeValueWithoutResponse
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-wr.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.writeValueWithoutResponse() method sets a BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic object's value property to the bytes contained in a given ArrayBuffer, calls WriteCharacteristicValue(this=this, value=value, response="never"), and returns the resulting Promise.
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-wr.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.writeValueWithoutResponse()

dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-wr.name: writeValueWithResponse
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-wr.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.writeValueWithResponse() method sets a BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic object's value property to the bytes contained in a given ArrayBuffer, calls WriteCharacteristicValue(this=this, value=value, response="required"), and returns the resulting Promise.
dom-bluetoothremotegattcharacteristic-wr.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic.writeValueWithResponse()

bluetoothgattcharacteristic-interface.name: BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic
bluetoothgattcharacteristic-interface.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGattCharacteristic interface of the Web Bluetooth API represents a GATT Characteristic, which is a basic data element that provides further information about a peripheral's service.

chrome.notes: Before Chrome 70, this feature was only supported in macOS. In Chrome 70, support was added for Windows 10. Linux support is not enabled by default.
In Linux and versions of Windows earlier than 10, this flag must be enabled.

edge_blink.notes: Before Chrome 70, this feature was only supported in macOS. In Chrome 70, support was added for Windows 10. Linux support is not enabled by default.
In Linux and versions of Windows earlier than 10, this flag must be enabled.

bluetoothgattcharacteristic-interface.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic

dom-bluetoothremotegattdescriptor-charac.name: characteristic
dom-bluetoothremotegattdescriptor-charac.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTDescriptor.characteristic read-only property returns the BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic this descriptor belongs to.
dom-bluetoothremotegattdescriptor-charac.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTDescriptor.characteristic

dom-bluetoothremotegattdescriptor-readva.name: readValue
dom-bluetoothremotegattdescriptor-readva.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTDescriptor.readValue() method returns a Promise that resolves to an ArrayBuffer holding a duplicate of the value property if it is available and supported. Otherwise it throws an error.
dom-bluetoothremotegattdescriptor-readva.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTDescriptor.readValue()

dom-bluetoothremotegattdescriptor-uuid.name: uuid
dom-bluetoothremotegattdescriptor-uuid.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTDescriptor.uuid read-only property returns the UUID of the characteristic descriptor. For example '00002902-0000-1000-8000-00805f9b34fb' for theClient Characteristic Configuration descriptor.
dom-bluetoothremotegattdescriptor-uuid.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTDescriptor.uuid

dom-bluetoothremotegattdescriptor-value.name: value
dom-bluetoothremotegattdescriptor-value.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTDescriptor.value read-only property returns an ArrayBuffer containing the currently cached descriptor value. This value gets updated when the value of the descriptor is read.
dom-bluetoothremotegattdescriptor-value.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTDescriptor.value

dom-bluetoothremotegattdescriptor-writev.name: writeValue
dom-bluetoothremotegattdescriptor-writev.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTDescriptor.writeValue() method sets the value property to the bytes contained in an ArrayBuffer and returns a Promise.
dom-bluetoothremotegattdescriptor-writev.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTDescriptor.writeValue()

bluetoothgattdescriptor-interface.name: BluetoothRemoteGATTDescriptor
bluetoothgattdescriptor-interface.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTDescriptor interface of the Web Bluetooth API provides a GATT Descriptor, which provides further information about a characteristic's value.

chrome.notes: Before Chrome 70, this feature was only supported in macOS. In Chrome 70, support was added for Windows 10. Linux support is not enabled by default.
In Linux and versions of Windows earlier than 10, this flag must be enabled.

edge_blink.notes: Before Chrome 70, this feature was only supported in macOS. In Chrome 70, support was added for Windows 10. Linux support is not enabled by default.
In Linux and versions of Windows earlier than 10, this flag must be enabled.

bluetoothgattdescriptor-interface.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTDescriptor

dom-bluetoothremotegattserver-connect.name: connect
dom-bluetoothremotegattserver-connect.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTServer.connect() method causes the script execution environment to connect to this.device.
dom-bluetoothremotegattserver-connect.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTServer.connect()

dom-bluetoothremotegattserver-connected.name: connected
dom-bluetoothremotegattserver-connected.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTServer.connected read-only property returns a boolean value that returns true while this script execution environment is connected to this.device. It can be false while the user agent is physically connected.
dom-bluetoothremotegattserver-connected.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTServer.connected

dom-bluetoothremotegattserver-device.name: device
dom-bluetoothremotegattserver-device.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTServer.device read-only property returns a reference to the BluetoothDevice running the server.
dom-bluetoothremotegattserver-device.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTServer.device

dom-bluetoothremotegattserver-disconnect.name: disconnect
dom-bluetoothremotegattserver-disconnect.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTServer.disconnect() method causes the script execution environment to disconnect from this.device.
dom-bluetoothremotegattserver-disconnect.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTServer.disconnect()

dom-bluetoothremotegattserver-getprimary.name: getPrimaryService
dom-bluetoothremotegattserver-getprimary.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTServer.getPrimaryService() method returns a promise to the primary BluetoothRemoteGATTService offered by the Bluetooth device for a specified BluetoothServiceUUID.
dom-bluetoothremotegattserver-getprimary.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTServer.getPrimaryService()

dom-bluetoothremotegattserver-getprimary.name: getPrimaryServices
dom-bluetoothremotegattserver-getprimary.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTServer.getPrimaryServices() method returns a promise to a list of primary BluetoothRemoteGATTService objects offered by the Bluetooth device for a specified BluetoothServiceUUID.
dom-bluetoothremotegattserver-getprimary.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTServer.getPrimaryServices()

bluetoothgattremoteserver-interface.name: BluetoothRemoteGATTServer
bluetoothgattremoteserver-interface.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTServer interface of the Web Bluetooth API represents a GATT Server on a remote device.

chrome.notes: Before Chrome 70, this feature was only supported in macOS. In Chrome 70, support was added for Windows 10. Linux support is not enabled by default.
In Linux and versions of Windows earlier than 10, this flag must be enabled.

edge_blink.notes: Before Chrome 70, this feature was only supported in macOS. In Chrome 70, support was added for Windows 10. Linux support is not enabled by default.
In Linux and versions of Windows earlier than 10, this flag must be enabled.

bluetoothgattremoteserver-interface.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTServer

dom-bluetoothremotegattservice-device.name: device
dom-bluetoothremotegattservice-device.summary: The BluetoothGATTService.device read-only property returns information about a Bluetooth device through an instance of BluetoothDevice.
dom-bluetoothremotegattservice-device.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTService.device

dom-bluetoothremotegattservice-getcharac.name: getCharacteristic
dom-bluetoothremotegattservice-getcharac.summary: The BluetoothGATTService.getCharacteristic() method returns a Promise to an instance of BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic for a given universally unique identifier (UUID).
dom-bluetoothremotegattservice-getcharac.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTService.getCharacteristic()

dom-bluetoothremotegattservice-getcharac.name: getCharacteristics
dom-bluetoothremotegattservice-getcharac.summary: The BluetoothGATTService.getCharacteristics() method returns a Promise to a list of BluetoothRemoteGATTCharacteristic instances for a given universally unique identifier (UUID).
dom-bluetoothremotegattservice-getcharac.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTService.getCharacteristics()

dom-bluetoothremotegattservice-isprimary.name: isPrimary
dom-bluetoothremotegattservice-isprimary.summary: The BluetoothGATTService.isPrimary read-only property returns a boolean value that indicates whether this is a primary service. If it is not a primary service, it is a secondary service.
dom-bluetoothremotegattservice-isprimary.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTService.isPrimary

dom-bluetoothremotegattservice-uuid.name: uuid
dom-bluetoothremotegattservice-uuid.summary: The BluetoothGATTService.uuid read-only property returns a string representing the UUID of this service.
dom-bluetoothremotegattservice-uuid.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTService.uuid

bluetoothgattservice-interface.name: BluetoothRemoteGATTService
bluetoothgattservice-interface.summary: The BluetoothRemoteGATTService interface of the Web Bluetooth API represents a service provided by a GATT server, including a device, a list of referenced services, and a list of the characteristics of this service.

chrome.notes: Before Chrome 70, this feature was only supported in macOS. In Chrome 70, support was added for Windows 10. Linux support is not enabled by default.
In Linux and versions of Windows earlier than 10, this flag must be enabled.

edge_blink.notes: Before Chrome 70, this feature was only supported in macOS. In Chrome 70, support was added for Windows 10. Linux support is not enabled by default.
In Linux and versions of Windows earlier than 10, this flag must be enabled.

bluetoothgattservice-interface.title: BluetoothRemoteGATTService

dom-bluetoothuuid-canonicaluuid.name: canonicalUUID
dom-bluetoothuuid-canonicaluuid.summary: The canonicalUUID() method of the BluetoothUUID interface returns the 128-bit UUID when passed a 16- or 32-bit UUID alias.
dom-bluetoothuuid-canonicaluuid.title: BluetoothUUID.canonicalUUID()

dom-bluetoothuuid-getcharacteristic.name: getCharacteristic
dom-bluetoothuuid-getcharacteristic.summary: The getCharacteristic() method of the BluetoothUUID interface returns a UUID representing a registered characteristic when passed a name or the 16- or 32-bit UUID alias.
dom-bluetoothuuid-getcharacteristic.title: BluetoothUUID.getCharacteristic()

dom-bluetoothuuid-getdescriptor.name: getDescriptor
dom-bluetoothuuid-getdescriptor.summary: The getDescriptor() method of the BluetoothUUID interface returns a UUID representing a registered descriptor when passed a name or the 16- or 32-bit UUID alias.
dom-bluetoothuuid-getdescriptor.title: BluetoothUUID.getDescriptor()

dom-bluetoothuuid-getservice.name: getService
dom-bluetoothuuid-getservice.summary: The getService() method of the BluetoothUUID interface returns a UUID representing a registered service when passed a name or the 16- or 32-bit UUID alias.
dom-bluetoothuuid-getservice.title: BluetoothUUID.getService()

bluetoothuuid.name: BluetoothUUID
bluetoothuuid.summary: The BluetoothUUID interface of the Web Bluetooth API provides a way to look up Universally Unique Identifier (UUID) values by name in the registry maintained by the Bluetooth SIG.

chrome.notes: Before Chrome 70, this feature was only supported in macOS. In Chrome 70, support was added for Windows 10. Linux support is not enabled by default.
In Linux and versions of Windows earlier than 10, this flag must be enabled.

edge_blink.notes: Before Chrome 70, this feature was only supported in macOS. In Chrome 70, support was added for Windows 10. Linux support is not enabled by default.
In Linux and versions of Windows earlier than 10, this flag must be enabled.

bluetoothuuid.title: BluetoothUUID
